page.title:
Partnerships for Improved Data
Partnerships for Improved Data
page.enlisting:
• Forward Progress: – Daily electronic access to the bulk of COOP data by – Common QC at the RCCs and NCDC – Mechanism for convenient daily communication of • A common complaint (from management and staff, from across the US): Eliminate NCDC QC Errors As Early As Possible. • RCCs/NCDC/AASC: Datzilla for error reports to engage NWS (HQ, regions, and field) to explore changes in both QC practices and the way they do business with us. • Forward Progress:
• Forward Progress:

page.title:
Standard (Base) CRN Station
Standard (Base) CRN Station
page.enlisting:
• 26-ft dia SDFIR, or 9-ft dia double alter. • CS 1000 datalogger, 34-month data storage. • GOES DCS communications with ice/snow antenna cover; 7-level layered comms. • 5-minute data reported hourly. • AC and Solar Power versions. • Modular, expandable, upgradable. • Weight: ~976 lbs. • Cost: ~$57K, calibrated & ready for deployment • 26-ft dia SDFIR, or 9-ft dia double alter. • CS 1000 datalogger, 34-month data storage. • GOES DCS communications with ice/snow antenna

• Temperature: three (3) aspirated platinum resistance • Precipitation: three-transducer, all-wx, weighing bucket precipitation gauge with wetness sensor. • Double-alter wind fence, stainless steel. • Newer CS 1000 datalogger, 34 months data storage. • GOES DCS comms. • 5-minute data reported hourly; 7-layer comms. • AC or Solar Power. • Modular: expandable, upgradable. • Data Standards same as Standard CRN Sta. • Weight: ~650-800 Lbs (solar pwr is heavier). • Cost: ~28K, calibrated & ready for deployment. • Temperature: three (3) aspirated platinum resistance
